snippet: Brokers used to promote bad investments mainly to people trying to get rich quick, but with traditional portfolios losing value, more ordinary retirement savers are being duped.
abstract: Regulators across the country are facing a wave of investor fraud that is saddling retirement savers with steep losses on complex products that historically were pitched only to the most sophisticated investors; some brokers are steering clients to risky investments as they attempt to make up for low interest rates and portfolios that have lost value.
lead_paragraph: Brokers used to promote bad investments mainly to people trying to get rich quick, but with traditional portfolios losing value, more ordinary retirement savers are being duped.

headline.seo: Wave of Investor Fraud Extends to Ordinary Retirement Savers
headline.main: Speculative Bets Prove Risky as Savers Chase Payoff
